page.title: 11THE CULWORTH BUTCHER
page.content: Two Domesday reporters from the school spent some time with the local butcher Mr Mumford.One day was spent with him buying meat. He goes to Weddels meat market in Market Harborough.He likes to see his meat before buying,lots of butchers just telephone orders today. There is one van just kept for meat.He bought half pigs,gammon,beef,English lamb and New Zealand lamb,liver,steak, it was a lot of meat and cost $2,500. That was to stock two shops,one in Culworth that has a village round and one in Banbury.As well as delivering, receiving deliveries and serving in the shops,MrMumford and family spend some time manufacturing sausages, rolling brisket,boning meat and mixing and pressing out beef burgers,the best for miles.Christan,Carl and Matthew help their mum and dad with lots of the jobs,they like the rounds best.
